intro: Lachenalia ustulata, commonly known as the rock lily, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, tubular stems and clustered, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It produces showy, often red or orange, flowers during the summer months. Lachenalia ustulata is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
